title: AI is not our future
heading: Championing Human Creativity in an AI World
description: I designed the viral Procreate's "AI is not our future" campaign, vowing that we will not ship generative AI in our products.

content.title: Going against the grain
text: As AI features are becoming the must-have addition for creative companies like Adobe and Figma and our biggest competitors are rushing to integrate generative AI capabilities, Procreate knew we had to take a clear stance. We chose to go against the grain and make a bold statement about our commitment to human creativity. We wanted to reassure our community that Procreate will always be a tool for human expression, nothing more.

On August 19th, we released a statement on X. James Cuda, Procreate's CEO, made a bold statement about our commitment to human creativity and promised that we would never ship generative AI in our products or train on our users' work. The response was overwhelming. Our post received over 22k reposts, 80k likes, 2k comments, 28k reposts, and 7k bookmarks.

content.title: Taking a stand for human creativity
text: As a company, we decided that Generative AI has no place in the journey of creative self-mastery. The goal of learning to paint and draw is to see the world around us and to develop our own artistic voice.

When we let AI generate our art, we rob ourselves of the essential skills that can only come through observation, practice, and dedication. The value of creative pursuit lies in the journey itselfâ€“the countless hours spent understanding light and shadow, form and perspective, and the complexities of the human form; a strenuous process of wrestling just to get better that no LLM can replace.

content.title: A screenshottable design
text: The webpage, which would complement James's statement on X, had to be punchy, impactful, bold, and confident. This was a bold move in our industry, and it was hard not to overstate it.

Our choice of photography emphasizes both the human aspect of creativity and the hopeful optimism we've adopted in the age of generative AI as we continue to ship creative tools to those who love the creative process.

content.title: Impact on the creative community
text: Procreate's bold stance resonated with artists and creatives worldwide, reinforcing the importance of human creativity in a digital age dominated by AI.

Our page received over 50k views in the week of the announcement. The campaign's highly screenshottable design led to massive organic sharing across social media platforms. Major tech and creative publications including [Wired](https://www.wired.com/story/procreate-app-no-generative-ai/), [Creative Bloq](https://www.creativebloq.com/news/procreate-ai-not-our-future), [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/08/19/procreate-takes-a-stand-against-ai-says-your-work-belongs-to-you/), and [The Verge](https://www.theverge.com/2024/8/19/24223473/procreate-anti-generative-ai-pledge-digital-illustration-creatives) covered the story, amplifying Procreate's message and sparking important discussions about the role of AI in creative industries.
